abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Second Fujian Highway
            Project for China were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was moderate,
            the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the Borrower
            performance was satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            measures included in the project to prevent or reduce
            occurrence of problems, mainly related to engineering
            designs, bid documents, and quality control during
            construction were appropriate and did contribute to reducing
            problems that had happened in past projects. However, more
            could have been done in further strengthening the detailed
            designs to allow better estimations of resettlement needs
            and bid market prices, as well as in undertaking more
            extensive geological investigations to reduce the amount of
            variation orders and increases in the initial contractual
            costs. Added emphasis in these activities is essential to
            strengthen the quality of the overall preparation of future
            similar type of projects. The project showed that in the
            case of the Zhangzhou Zhao'an Expressway (ZZE) some
            items, such as number of houses relocated, turned out to be
            close to twice as large as the initial estimate. While final
            compensation payments reflected the more detailed designs
            and the actual impact of the new construction, a better
            initial assessment will have permitted a better budgeting of
            expenses and ensuring that funds were available when needed.

5086106.trustfund:
TF036643-CHINA - FOURTH NATIONAL AND
            SECOND FUJIAN PROVINCIAL HGIHWAYS,TF037982-CHINA - SECOND FUJIAN HIGHWAY PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Fujian Highway Project aims
            to increase economic activity along the Fuzhou-Shenzhen
            high-priority transport corridor through relieving
            congestion, facilitating trade and mobility, and helping
            increase efficiency and traffic safety in Southern Fujian.
            There are three project components. The first component
            constructs an expressway, a divided, four-lane,
            access-controlled toll highway; interchanges; service areas
            providing facilities for refueling and vehicle repair,
            restaurants, parking and rest stops; facilities for
            expressway administration and maintenance; and electrical
            and mechanical installations for toll collection, traffic
            monitoring, telecommunications and tunnel lighting, and all
            interchanges and annex areas. This component also improves
            existing and constructs interconnecting roads as well as
            other roads, provides equipment, and funds construction
            supervision services. The second component funds studies and
            technical assistance in highway maintenance management, and
            toll rates and road safety; and designs an institutional
            development plan. This component also trains staff in
            programs covering all aspects of highway planning, design,
            construction, operation, finance, and maintenance. The third
            component supports a front-end fee while the fourth
            component finances land acquisition and resettlement mainly
            through providing compensation at replacement cost and subsidies.

442057.trustfund:
TF025103-PHRD-SECOND FUJIAN HIGHWAY PROJECT,TF037982-CHINA - SECOND FUJIAN HIGHWAY PROJECT,TF036643-CHINA - FOURTH NATIONAL AND
            SECOND FUJIAN PROVINCIAL HGIHWAYS

abstracts.cdata!:
This report includes environmental
            impact assessments and action plans for the Second Fujian
            Highway Project, which constructs the Zhangzhou-Zhao'an
            Expressway and an interconnecting road and bridge program to
            relieve traffic congestion and improve the mobility and
            integration of inter-provincial trade, commerce, and tourism
            between Fujian and Guangdong provinces. Negative
            environmental impact mitigation include: Road surfaces,
            excavation areas, and construction sites will be sprayed
            with water and kept moist. Trucks will be distanced from
            residential sites or other sensitive spots. Ventilation fans
            will reduce air pollution. Asphalt mixing equipment will
            have dust collectors and be distanced from residential
            areas. Vegetation restoration including greenbelts on
            roadsides will rehabilitate the land. Afforestation, a
            soundproofing screen, and a restricted schedule for
            operating construction equipment and vehicles will reduce
            noise levels. Dumping levels will not exceed the surrounding
            ground level, intercepting ditches will be installed, blind
            pipes will discharge seepage, and borrow and spoil sites
            will be reconstructed or leveled after construction. To
            prevent water pollution, oil collection tanks, oil-water
            separators, garbage collecting stations, drainage gates, and
            controlled sand digging will be used, along with treatment
            of wastewater and sewage. Hazardous materials will be
            strictly monitored. Displaced persons will be resettled and compensated.

display_title.display_title:
China - Second Fujian Highway
            Project (Vol. 2) : Zhangzhou-Zhaoan Expressway :
            Environmental Action Plan

441157.subtopic:
Sanitation and Sewerage,Roads & Highways,Water Conservation,Water and Industry,Water Supply and Sanitation Governance
            and Institutions
441157.admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific
441157.trustfund:
TF036643-CHINA - FOURTH NATIONAL AND
            SECOND FUJIAN PROVINCIAL HGIHWAYS,TF037982-CHINA - SECOND FUJIAN HIGHWAY PROJECT,TF025103-PHRD-SECOND FUJIAN HIGHWAY PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
This report includes environmental
            impact assessments and action plans for the Second Fujian
            Highway Project, which constructs the Zhangzhou-Zhao'an
            Expressway and an interconnecting road and bridge program to
            relieve traffic congestion and improve the mobility and
            integration of inter-provincial trade, commerce, and tourism
            between Fujian and Guangdong provinces. Negative
            environmental impact mitigation include: Road surfaces,
            excavation areas, and construction sites will be sprayed
            with water and kept moist. Trucks will be distanced from
            residential sites or other sensitive spots. Ventilation fans
            will reduce air pollution. Asphalt mixing equipment will
            have dust collectors and be distanced from residential
            areas. Vegetation restoration including greenbelts on
            roadsides will rehabilitate the land. Afforestation, a
            soundproofing screen, and a restricted schedule for
            operating construction equipment and vehicles will reduce
            noise levels. Dumping levels will not exceed the surrounding
            ground level, intercepting ditches will be installed, blind
            pipes will discharge seepage, and borrow and spoil sites
            will be reconstructed or leveled after construction. To
            prevent water pollution, oil collection tanks, oil-water
            separators, garbage collecting stations, drainage gates, and
            controlled sand digging will be used, along with treatment
            of wastewater and sewage. Hazardous materials will be
            strictly monitored. Displaced persons will be resettled and compensated.
